text: Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D. [Subroutine] Trace7– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.

title: Student Loans
text: As an additional cost to play an event that there is a copy of in his or her heap, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].
flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.

title: Meru Mati
text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.

title: Breaker Bay Grid
text: The rez cost of cards in this server is lowered by 5. Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.

title: Immolation Script
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing a piece of ice in Archives, trash a rezzed copy of that ice.

title: Skulljack
text:
When you install Skulljack, suffer 1 brain damage.
The trash cost of all cards is lowered by 1.

title: Turntable
text: +1[Memory Unit] Whenever you steal an agenda, you may swap that agenda with an agenda in the Corp's score area. Limit 1 console per player.

title: Chrome Parlor
text: Prevent all meat damage and brain damage from installing cybernetics.
flavor: Picking a chopper might be the last decision you make. If you find a good one, stick with her for life.

title: Titanium Ribs
text:
When you install Titanium Ribs, suffer 2 meat damage.
You choose the card(s) from your grip to trash whenever you take damage (including the damage taken by installing Titanium Ribs).

title: Crowbar
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Crowbar is 0, even if it is not installed. Crowbar has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [Trash]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.

title: Net-Ready Eyes
text: When you install Net-Ready Eyes, suffer 2 meat damage. Whenever you initiate a run, choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.

title: Analog Dreamers
text: [Click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may choose an unrezzed non-ice card with no advancement tokens on it in a server and shuffle it into R&D.

title: Brain Cage
text:
When you install Brain Cage, suffer 1 brain damage.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 3.
flavor: The skull is not one bone, but 22. The surgery is even more complex than it sounds.

title: Cybernetics Division: Humanity Upgraded
text: Each player's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
flavor: Define Yourself.

title: Self-Destruct Chips
text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
flavor: Cyber enhancements can be dangerous in the wrong hands.

title: Lab Dog
text: [Subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware. Trash Lab Dog.

title: Oaktown Grid
text: The trash cost of cards installed in this server is increased by 3. Limit 1 region per server.

title: Ryon Knight
text: [Trash]: Do 1 brain damage. Use this ability only during a run on this server and only if the Runner has no unspent clicks.
flavor: "Bioroids recognize consciousness in others, but not in themselves."

title: Clairvoyant Monitor
text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 advancement token on an installed card and end the run.

title: Lockdown
text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot draw cards for the remainder of this turn.

title: Little Engine
text:
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] The Runner gains 5[Credits].

title: Oaktown Renovation
text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[Credits] (or 3[Credits] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).

title: Corporate Town
text:
As an additional cost to rez Corporate Town, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).

title: Quicksand
text:
When the Runner encounters Quicksand, place 1 power counter on Quicksand.
Quicksand has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.

title: Faust
text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.
flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.

title: Street Peddler
text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[Trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.
flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"

title: Armand "Geist" Walker: Tech Lord
text: Whenever you use a [Trash] ability, draw 1 card.
flavor: "Everything has a price."

title: Drive By
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.

title: Forger
text: +1[Link] [Trash]: Avoid or remove 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.

title: Shiv
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Shiv is 0, even if it is not installed. Shiv has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [Trash]: Break up to 3 sentry subroutines.

title: Gang Sign
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, access 1 card from HQ.
flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.

title: Muertos Gang Member
text:
When you install Muertos Gang Member, the Corp must derez a card.
When Muertos Gang Member is uninstalled, the Corp may rez a card, ignoring the rez cost.
[Trash]: Draw 1 card.
flavor: La Señora de las Sombras giveth and taketh away.

title: Chameleon
text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1[Credits]: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.

title: Hyperdriver
text: When your turn begins, you may remove Hyperdriver from the game and gain [Click][Click][Click].
flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." —Hayley Kaplan

title: Test Ground
text:
Test Ground can be advanced.
[Trash]: Derez 1 card for each advancement token on Test Ground.
flavor:
"Isn't this wrong?"
"Not legally. They didn't read the fine print."

title: Defective Brainchips
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner takes a brain damage each turn, he or she takes 1 additional brain damage.

title: Allele Repression
text:
Allele Repression can be advanced.
[Trash]: Exchange 1 card in HQ with 1 card in Archives for each advancement token on Allele Repression.

title: Marcus Batty
text: [Trash]: You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, resolve 1 subroutine on a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. Use this ability only during a run on this server.

title: Exposé
text:
Exposé can be advanced.
[Trash]: Remove 1 bad publicity for each advancement token on Exposé.
flavor: "Is your neighbor secretly a violent criminal? The answer to this chilling question and more, right after the break." —Shannon Claire, SSN 5

title: Pachinko
text:
[Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
flavor: Pa-pa-pa-chinko!

title: Underway Renovation
text:
Install Underway Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Underway Renovation, trash the top card of the Runner's stack (or the top 2 cards instead if there are 4 or more advancement tokens on Underway Renovation).

title: Contract Killer
text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[Click], [Trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"

title: Spiderweb
text:
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." —g00ru

title: Underway Grid
text: Ice protecting this server cannot be bypassed. Cards in and protecting this server cannot be exposed. Limit 1 region per server.

title: Trope
text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Trope. [Click], remove Trope from the game: Shuffle 1 card from your heap into your stack for each power counter on Trope.
flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" —Princess Space Kitten

title: Spoilers
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, he or she trashes the top card of R&D.
flavor: Don't you hate it when you know everything before it's even out?

title: Drug Dealer
text:
When your turn begins, lose 1[Credits].
When the Corp's turn begins, draw 1 card.
flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."

title: Rolodex
text:
When you install Rolodex, look at the top 5 cards ot your stack and arrange them in any order.
When Rolodex is trashed, trash the top 3 cards of your stack.
flavor: "I told you to lose my number!"

title: Fan Site
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, add Fan Site to your score area as an agenda worth 0 agenda points.
flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.

title: Film Critic
text:
Film Critic can host a single agenda.
Whenever you access an agenda, you may host that agenda on Film Critic (the agenda is no longer being accessed and is uninstalled).
[Click],[Click]: Add an agenda hosted on Film Critic to your score area.
flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."

title: Paparazzi
text:
You are tagged.
Prevent all meat damage.
flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"

title: Ronald Five
text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Ronald Five), he or she loses [Click].
flavor: "It's our most pirated property ever. Great work, everyone."

title: Enforcer 1.0
text: As an additional cost to rez Enforcer 1.0, the Corp must forfeit an agenda. The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Enforcer 1.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trash 1 console. [Subroutine] Trash all virtual resources.

title: It's a Trap!
text:
Whenever It's a Trap! is exposed, do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards. Trash It's a Trap!.
flavor: I warned you.

title: An Offer You Can't Refuse
text: Choose a central server. The runner may initiate a run on that server during which he or she cannot jack out. Otherwise, add An Offer You Can't Refuse to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

title: Haarpsichord Studios: Entertainment Unleashed
text: The Runner cannot steal more than one agenda each turn.
flavor: Home of Your Imagination.

title: Award Bait
text:
If Award Bait is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Award Bait, you may place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.

title: Explode-a-palooza
text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[Credits].
flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.

title: Early Premiere
text: When your turn begins, you may pay 1[Credits]. If you do, place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced in a server.

title: Casting Call
text: Install an agenda from HQ faceup and install Casting Call on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with text "Whenever the Runner accesses this agenda, he or she takes 2 tags."

title: Old Hollywood Grid
text: Agenda accessed from this server cannot be stolen unless the Runner already has a copy of that agenda in his or her score area. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Old Hollywood Grid. Limit 1 region per server.

title: Hollywood Renovation
text:
Install Hollywood Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Hollywood Renovation, you may place 1 advancement token on another card that can be advanced (or 2 advancement tokens instead if there are 6 or more advancement tokens on Hollywood Renovation).

title: Back Channels
text: Trash a card installed in a server and gain 3[Credits] for each advancement token on that card.
flavor: Sometimes corps have to bury projects, but that doesn't mean they can't make a profit on them.

title: Vanity Project
flavor:
EXT. KANSAS – DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore. 
She begins to hum a haunting melody.

title: Power to the People
text:
Play only as your first [Click].
The first time you access an agenda this turn, gain 7[Credits].
flavor: As the sun sank towards the horizon, the glittering lights of the expo remained dark. But the shanty city bloomed to life.

title: Surfer
text: 2[Credits]: Swap a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered with a piece of ice directly before or after it. The run continues from this new position. You are still encountering that ice.
flavor: Cowabunga, dude!

title: DDoS
text: [Trash]: The Corp cannot rez the outermost piece of ice during a run on any server this turn.
flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." —Ji "Noise" Reilly

title: Laramy Fisk: Savvy Investor
text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, you may force the Corp to draw 1 card.

title: Fisk Investment Seminar
text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Each player draws 3 cards.
flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." —Laramy Fisk

title: Bookmark
text:
[Click]: Host up to 3 cards from your grip facedown on Bookmark (you may look at these cards at any time).
[Click] or [Trash]: Add all cards on Bookmark to your grip.

title: DaVinci
text:
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 power counter on DaVinci.
[Trash]: Install a card from your grip with an install cost equal to or less than the number of power counters on DaVinci, ignoring the install cost.
flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." —Leonardo Da Vinci

title: Wireless Net Pavilion
text:
As an additional cost to spend [Click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability), the Corp must pay 2[Credits].

(errata from FAQ 3.0.1)
flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.

title: Cybernetics Court
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 4.
flavor: The Cybernetics Court has seven floors of attractions. The plasteel used to construct it was even more expensive than the thousands of cybernetic implants displayed inside.

title: Team Sponsorship
text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.

title: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping
text: For the first net damage the Runner suffers each turn, you may look at the Runner's grip and select the card that is trashed.

title: Ancestral Imager
text: Whenever the Runner jacks out, do 1 net damage.
flavor: The more people submit their DNA and family history to the program, the more accurate it becomes.

title: Genetics Pavilion
text: The Runner cannot draw more than 2 cards during his or her turn.
flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.

title: Franchise City
text: When the Runner accesses an agenda, add Franchise City to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
flavor: There are over 20,000 brands represented in Franchise City, all of them owned by fewer than 100 corps.

title: Product Placement
text:
If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Product Placement, the Corp gains 2[Credits]. Ignore this effect if Product Placement is accessed from Archives.

title: Worlds Plaza
text:
Worlds Plaza can host up to 3 assets.
[Click]: Install an asset from HQ on Worlds Plaza and rez it, lowering its rez cost by 2, if able.
flavor: The holosculpture depicts the three inhabited worlds. The square can hold almost 1% of their total population.

title: Public Support
text:
Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.

title: Tour Guide
text: Tour Guide gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed asset you have.
flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."

title: Expo Grid
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] if there is a rezzed asset installed in this server. Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: The expo was built in the East California desert: a temporary city constructed for the advancement of humanity.

title: The Future is Now
text: When you score The Future is Now, search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

title: SYNC: Everything, Everywhere
text:
[Click]: Flip this identity.

The Runner pays 1[Credits] more when spending a [Click] to remove a tag (not through a card ability).

Flip side:

[Click]: Flip this identity.

You may pay 2[Credits] fewer when spending a [Click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability).

title: New Angeles Sol: Your News
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may play 1 current from HQ or Archives (paying its play cost).
flavor: Nothing but the Truth.

title: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach
text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[Credits].
flavor: We're ready to start the fire.

title: 15 Minutes
text:
[Click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.
flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.

title: Improved Tracers
text: All tracer ice have +1 strength. The base trace strength of each subroutine is increased by 1.
flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." —KR Kane, "Our Future"

title: Rebranding Team
text: All assets gain advertisement.
flavor: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." —Phineas Taylor Barnum

title: Quantum Predictive Model
text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.
flavor: "Yes and No."

title: Lily Lockwell
text: When you rez Lily Lockwell, draw 3 cards. [Click], remove 1 tag: Search R&D for an operation, reveal it, and shuffle the rest of R&D. Add the operation to the top of R&D.
flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."

title: News Team
text:
If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth −1 agenda point.

title: Shannon Claire
text:
[Click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of R&D.
[Trash]: Search R&D or Archives for an agenda and reveal it. Shuffle the rest of R&D if you searched it. Add the agenda to the bottom of R&D.
flavor: No one can bury a story better.

title: Victoria Jenkins
text:
The Runner has 1 fewer [Click] to spend during his or her turn.
If Victoria Jenkins is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

title: Reality Threedee
text:
When you rez Reality Threedee, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] (or 2[Credits] if the Runner is tagged).
flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." —MaxX

title: Archangel
text: If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. If you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives. [Subroutine] Trace6– If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.

title: News Hound
text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."

title: Resistor
text: Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, end the run.
flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." —Chaos Theory

title: Special Offer
text: [Subroutine] The Corp gains 5[Credits]. Trash Special Offer.
flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." —John Masanori

title: TL;DR
text: [Subroutine] When the Runner encounters the next piece of ice during this run, that ice gains a second copy of each subroutine on it (after the original subroutine) for the remainder of the encounter.
flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice

title: Turnpike
text: When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." —g00ru

title: 24/7 News Cycle
text:
As an additional cost to play 24/7 News Cycle, forfeit an agenda.
Resolve the "when scored" ability on an agenda in your score area.
flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...

title: Ad Blitz
text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Install and rez (paying all costs) X advertisements from Archives and/or HQ, if able.

title: Media Blitz
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Choose an agenda in the Runner's score area. Media Blitz gains the text of that agenda.

title: The All-Seeing I
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash all resources. The Runner can remove 1 bad publicity to prevent this.
flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." —The Playbook

title: Surveillance Sweep
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner must spend credits first for each trace attempt during a run.

title: Keegan Lane
text: [Trash], remove 1 tag: Trash 1 program. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."

title: Rutherford Grid
text: The base trace strength of each trace during a run on this server is increased by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.

title: Global Food Initiative
text: Global Food Initiative is worth 1 fewer agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." —Sunny Lebeau

title: Launch Campaign
text:
Place 6[Credits] from the bank on Launch Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Launch Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[Credits] from Launch Campaign.

title: Assassin
text: [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, do 3 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, trash 1 program.
flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.

title: Apex: Invasive Predator
text: You cannot install non-virtual resources. When your turn begins, you may install 1 card from your grip facedown.

title: Apocalypse
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.

title: Prey
text: Make a run. Once during this run, when you pass a piece of ice, you may trash a number of your installed cards equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, trash that ice.

title: Heartbeat
text: +1[Memory Unit] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.
flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." —Edgar Allan Poe

title: Endless Hunger
text: Trash an installed card: Break "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine.
flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." —Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst

title: Harbinger
text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.

title: Hunting Grounds
text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[Trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.
flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." —Reeve

title: Wasteland
text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[Credits].
flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.

title: Adam: Compulsive Hacker
text: You start the game with 3 different directive cards installed (these cards are not considered part of your deck).

title: Independent Thinking
text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).
flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.

title: Brain Chip
text: +X[Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.

title: Multithreader
text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.
flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.

title: Always Be Running
text: Your first [Click] each turn must be spent to make a run or a play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [Click][Click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.
flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.

title: Dr. Lovegood
text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.
flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."

title: Neutralize All Threats
text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, you must trash it by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.
flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.

title: Safety First
text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.
flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.

title: Sunny Lebeau: Security Specialist
flavor: "Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."

title: Security Chip
text: [Trash]: Choose an icebreaker (or any number of cloud icebreakers). Each chosen icebreaker has +1 strength for each [Link] you have for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.

title: Security Nexus
text: +1[Memory Unit] +1[Link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace5– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.

title: GS Striker M1
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
flavor: Bigger.

title: GS Shrike M2
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
flavor: Badder.

title: GS Sherman M3
text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
flavor: Boom.

title: Globalsec Security Clearance
text:
Install only if you have at least 2[Link].
When your turn begins, you may lose [Click]. If you do, look at the top card of R&D.
flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.

title: Jak Sinclair
text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [Link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.
flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."

title: Employee Strike
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.
flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."

title: Windfall
text: Shuffle your stack. Trash the top card of your stack. Gain X[Credits] where X is equal to the install cost of that card.
flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.

title: Technical Writer
text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[Credits] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[Click],[Trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.
flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.

title: Run Amok
text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.

title: Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI
text:
[Trash]: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed).
Limit 6 per deck.

title: Street Magic
text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.

title: High-stakes Job
text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[Credits] if it was successful.

title: Mongoose
text: You cannot use Mongoose to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. 1[Credits]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[Credits]: +2 strength.

title: Jesminder Sareen: Girl Behind the Curtain
text: Avoid the first tag during each run.
flavor: "Mirrormode on."

title: Maya
text: +2[Memory Unit] Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.

title: Panchatantra
text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.
flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child - unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." - g00ru

title: Artist Colony
text: Forfeit an agenda: Search your stack for a card and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." - Oscar Wilde

title: Chatterjee University
text:
[Click]: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University.
[Click]: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.

title: Advanced Concept Hopper
text: The first time the Runner initiates  a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1[Credits].

title: Vikram 1.0
text: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Vikram 1.0. [Subroutine] The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, do 1 brain damage.

title: Heritage Committee
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.

title: Mumbad City Grid
text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.

title: Kala Ghoda Real TV
text:
When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack.
[Trash]: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.

title: Interrupt 0
text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[Credits] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[Credits] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.

title: Dedication Ceremony
text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." - Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion

title: Mumba Temple
text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck.
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez cards.

title: Museum of History
text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck.
When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D.
flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earh."

title: Diwan
text:
When Diwan is installed, choose a server. As an additional cost to install a card in or protecting that server, the Corp must pay 1[Credits].
Trash Diwan if the Corp purges virus counters.

title: Corporate Scandal
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).

title: Populist Rally
text: Play only if you have at least 1 seedy card installed. The Corp has 1 fewer [Click] to spend on his or her next turn.

title: Advanced Assembly Lines
text:
When you rez Advanced Assembly Lines, gain 3[Credits].
[Trash]: Install a non-agenda card from HQ (paying the install cost). You cannot use this ability during a run.

title: Pālanā Foods
text: The first time each turn the Runner draws a card, gain 1[Credits].

title: Harvester
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
[Subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.

title: Corporate Sales Team
text:
When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[Credits] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[Credits] from Corporate Sales Team.

title: Political Graffiti
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, add Political Graffiti to an agenda in the Corp's score area as a hosted condition counter with the text "This agenda is worth -1 agenda points. Trash Political Graffiti if the Corp purges virus counters."

title: Nero Severn: Information Broker
text: Once per turn, you may jack out when you encounter a sentry.

title: Reflection
text: +1[Memory Unit] +1[Link] Whenever you jack out, the Corp reveals 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.

title: Spy Camera
text:
[Click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[Trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.

title: Political Operative
text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [Trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.

title: Akshara Sareen
text: Each player has 1 additional [Click] to spend during his or her turn.

title: Councilman
text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.

title: "Clones are not People"
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When you score an agenda, add "Clones are not People" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.

title: Bailiff
text:
Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Bailiff, gain 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run.

title: Surat City Grid
text: Whenever you rez a card in or protecting this server (not including Surat City Grid), you may rez another card, lowering the rez cost by 2. Limit 1 region per server.

title: Making an Entrance
text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Look at the top 6 cards of your stack. You may trash any of those cards and arrange the rest in any order.

title: Exclusive Party
text:
Draw 1 card. Gain 1[Credits] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.

title: Brahman
text: 1[Credits]: Break up to 2 ice subroutines. 2[Credits]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Brahman to break a subroutine ends, add 1 installed non-virus program to the top of your deck.

title: Patron
text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server.
The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, draw 2 cards.

title: Sports Hopper
text:
+1[Link]
[Trash]: Draw 3 cards.

title: Jeeves Model Bioroids
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. The first time you spend 3[Click] on the same action each turn, gain [Click].
flavor: "Very good, sir."

title: Raman Rai
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Once per turn, you may lose [Click] when you draw a card. If you do, reveal that card and a card in Archives of the same type, then swap those cards.

title: Aryabhata Tech
text: Whenever there is a successful trace, gain 1[Credits] and the Runner loses 1[Credits].

title: Salem's Hospitality
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. Name a card. The Runner reveals his or her grip and trashes all copies of the named card from his or her grip.

title: Executive Search Firm
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. [Click]: Search R&D for an executive, sysop, or character, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

title: Mumbad Virtual Tour
text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 7 or more assets in your deck.
If the Runner access Mumbad Virtual Tour while it is installed, he or she must trash it, if able.

title: Temple of the Liberated Mind
text: [Click]: Place 1 power counter on Temple of the Liberated Mind. Hosted power counter: Gain [Click]. Use this ability only on your turn and only once per turn.

title: Rebirth
text:
Switch your identity with another identity from the same faction. Remove Rebirth from the game instead of trashing it.
Limit 1 per deck.

title: Guru Davinder
text:
Prevent all net and meat damage.
Whenever Guru Davinder prevents at least 1 net or meat damage, trash him unless you pay 4[Credits].

title: The Turning Wheel
text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, place 1 power counter on The Turning Wheel if you stole no agendas during the run. 2 hosted power counters: For the remainder of this run, access 1 additional card from HQ or R&D.

title: Ravana 1.0
text: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. [Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. [Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.

title: Brainstorm
text: When the Runner encounters Brainstorm, it gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

title: Chetana
text:
[Subroutine] Each player gains 2[Credits].
[Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.

title: Waiver
text: [Subroutine]Trace5- If successful, the Runner reveals his or her grip. Trash each of those cards with a play or install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.

title: Vanilla
text: [Subroutine] End the run.

title: Fear the Masses
text:
Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.

title: Bhagat
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.

title: The Black File
text:
The Corp cannot win the game unless the Runner is flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.

title: The Price of Freedom
text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed connection. The Corp cannot advance cards during his or her next turn. Remove The Price of Freedom from the game instead of trashing it.

title: Voter Intimidation
text:
Play only if there is an agenda in the Runner's score area.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, trash 1 resource.

title: Full Immersion RecStudio
text:
Full Immersion RecStudio can host up to 2 assets and/or agendas.
The trash cost of Full Immersion RecStudio is increased by 3 for each card hosted on it.

title: Ibrahim Salem
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to rez Ibrahim Salem, forfeit an agenda. When your turn begins, name a card type. Look at the Runner's grip and trash 1 card in it of the named type.
